title: Hired five assistant professors, four are females
content: please add photos, research areas and their PhD institutions

title: Lead a project representing TTU as one of five organizations (among GE, Purdue university, etc.) that won DOE Funding through Cybersecurity Manufacturing Innovation Institute (Sep 27, 2021)
content: Rattikorn Hewett lead a project representing TTU as one of five organizations (among GE, Purdue university, etc.) that won DOE Funding through Cybersecurity Manufacturing Innovation Institute (Sep 27, 2021). The project titled "Energy baselining, Optimization and Security Augmentation of Oil Refinery" includes multidisciplinary engineering co-Is (V.Shankar, T. Dang) and industrial partner with Dylek (E. Bediago).

title: Supadchaya Puangpontip, a PhD student won a grant support from CRA (Computing Research Association) to participate in 2022 CRA-WP Grad Cohort for Women
content: Supadchaya Puangpontip, a PhD student won a grant support from CRA (Computing Research Association) to participate in 2022 CRA-WP Grad Cohort for Women

title: Hosted 8 Brazillian students for REU
content: As part of the college International program and recruitment, hosted 8 Brazillian students for REU during Fall (get details from George Spoth)

title: Faranak Abri, a PhD student won a grant support from CRA
content: Faranak Abri, a PhD student won a grant support from CRA (Computing Research Association) to participate in 2022 CRA-WP Grad Cohort for Women

title: Received grant from Office of Navy Research on Automatically Measuring Phishing Victim Susceptibility
content: Received grant from Office of Navy Research on Automatically Measuring Phishing Victim Susceptibility from Publicly Available Information, 2021. The amount of award is $784,732.

title: Two student teams from Texas Tech University are participating in the 2022 Winter Classic Student Cluster Competition in Spring 2022 and competing against the rest ten teams from Historically Black and Hispanic universities. Read more about this ongoing story from the media coverage of HPCwire (https://www.hpcwire.com/tag/winter-classic/).
content: Two student teams from Texas Tech University are participating in the 2022 Winter Classic Student Cluster Competition in Spring 2022 and competing against the rest ten teams from Historically Black and Hispanic universities. Read more about this ongoing story from the media coverage of HPCwire (https://www.hpcwire.com/tag/winter-classic/).

title: Dr. A. Namin gain Federal grants
content: Federal grants on cybersecurity to measure individual susceptibility against social engineering attacks (Dr. A. Namin with collaborators from the Department of Psychology)

title: Dr. Y. Zhuang gain the Federal grants
content: Federal grants on data science to leverage the growing process of datasets to deliver efficient search and data organizing (Dr. Y. Zhuang)

title: Industrial grants with General Motor
content: Industrial grants with General Motor to optimize vehicle sequencing in general assembly (Drs. L. Chen, Y. Chen)

title: Industrial grants with AVX Aircraft Company
content: Industrial grants with AVX Aircraft Company/US Army to develop metrics/dashboard for validating aircraft health, and to study the integrity and quality of aviation logistics and maintenance data (Dr. T. Dang)

title: Best Paper Award, the 35th IEEE International Parallel & Distributed Processing Symposium (IPDPS'21)
content: Best Paper Award, the 35th IEEE International Parallel & Distributed Processing Symposium (IPDPS'21), the flagship conference of the IEEE TCPP (Technical Committee on Parallel Processing), entitled "xBGAS: A Global Address Space Extension on RISC-V for High Performance Computin" (Xi Wang, Dr. Chen's Ph.D. student and team).

title: Best Paper Award, SmartNets 2021
content: Best Paper Award, SmartNets 2021, entitled "On Finger Stretching and Bending Dynamics as a Biometric Modality" (Sraddhanjali Acharya, Dr. Serwadda's Ph.D. student)

title: Best Paper Award, the IEEE International Conference on Electro-Information Technology (EIT) 2021
content: Best Paper Award, the IEEE International Conference on Electro-Information Technology (EIT) 2021, entitled “Finite Element Simulation of Inkjet Printed Flexible Parallel Plate MIM Capacitors on Polyimide Film” (Dr. Morshed and students)

title:
IUCRC Center for Cloud and Autonomic Computing at Texas Tech University has received NSF funding to be elevated to
Phase II (Drs. Y. Chen, S. Mengel, T. Dang)
Ministry of Education Saudi Arabia provided grant
content: Ministry of Education Saudi Arabia provided grant to study physical unclonable functions as security primitive for security of resource constrained IoT devices (Dr. Y. Zhuang).
